story.title: #MuseumOfTheFuture - third debate
story.description: The third #MuseumOfTheFuture debate 'Bloomsbury and the world: the new Knowledge Quarter in Camden' took place on Tuesday 18 November

author.name: British Museum
author.bio: A museum of the world, for the world.

image.caption: Follow us tonight for live tweets from the final #MuseumOfTheFuture debate, from 19.00! http://t.co/nRYcrxeVjm

quote.text: Looking forward to start of #MuseumOfTheFuture debate @britishmuseum 'Bloomsbury and the world: the new Knowledge Quarter in Camden'

user.description: KQ is a partnership of 35 knowledge-based institutions in the heart of London: a focal point for the greatest concentration of knowledge anywhere in the world.
user.name: Knowledge Quarter

meta.text: Looking forward to start of #MuseumOfTheFuture debate @britishmuseum 'Bloomsbury and the world: the new Knowledge Quarter in Camden'

meta.text: Munira Mirza: pure research combined with its application is important #MuseumOfTheFuture #knowledgequarter

quote.text: @KQ_London cannot wait to know more! Such cross-institutional collaboration is long overdue. #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.description: European Identity @LSEEI, Museum Cultures @BirkbeckHoA The place of art in society: cultural heritage, museums, and cultural policy. Views own.
user.name: Laura Kugel

meta.text: @KQ_London cannot wait to know more! Such cross-institutional collaboration is long overdue. #MuseumOfTheFuture

quote.text: I rather like 'discovery without boundaries' from Sir Paul Nurse - sounds a motto for creatives as much as scientists. #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.description: Marketer @SpecialistWorks ‘Very important’ – Sir Antony Gormley. Museum enthusiast. Food historian. Questioning feminist. Hat lover. Known ginger.
user.name: Imogen Steinberg

meta.text: I rather like 'discovery without boundaries' from Sir Paul Nurse - sounds a motto for creatives as much as scientists. #MuseumOfTheFuture

quote.text: Munira Mirza mentions that London has 4 of the world's top ten universities #MuseumOfTheFuture #knowledgequarter

user.description: Curator, Digital Research @britishlibrary Co-founded Off the Map videogame design competition http://t.co/0X77wiqcdv
user.name: Stella Wisdom

meta.text: Munira Mirza mentions that London has 4 of the world's top ten universities #MuseumOfTheFuture #knowledgequarter

quote.text: .@rolykeating: #knowledgequarter is open and growing – not just for the "grand institutions" #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.description: Curator, Digital Research @britishlibrary Co-founded Off the Map videogame design competition http://t.co/0X77wiqcdv
user.name: Stella Wisdom

meta.text: Paul Nurse says that @britishlibrary & @britishmuseum have an important role in inspiring young people #MuseumOfTheFuture #knowledgequarter

quote.text: Great question on how @KQ_London avoids being a theme park and find a balance between scholarship and popularity #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.description: Head of Higher Education at the British Library, tweeting in personal capacity
user.name: Maja Maricevic

meta.text: Great question on how @KQ_London avoids being a theme park and find a balance between scholarship and popularity #MuseumOfTheFuture

quote.text: How do you balence popular and scholarly?- from the audience. Are the two mutually exclusive? I'm not sure they are. #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.description: Marketer @SpecialistWorks ‘Very important’ – Sir Antony Gormley. Museum enthusiast. Food historian. Questioning feminist. Hat lover. Known ginger.
user.name: Imogen Steinberg

meta.text: How do you balence popular and scholarly?- from the audience. Are the two mutually exclusive? I'm not sure they are. #MuseumOfTheFuture

quote.text: .@rolykeating: pitch a social public space just right and people will come #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@rolykeating: pitch a social public space just right and people will come #MuseumOfTheFuture

quote.text: Neil McGregor has just done an excellent impersonation of a pterodactyl #MuseumOfTheFuture

user.description: Curator by day @BritishLibrary. History, cycling, books, digital things. Tweets with the usual caveats.
user.name: Matt Shaw

meta.text: Neil McGregor has just done an excellent impersonation of a pterodactyl #MuseumOfTheFuture

quote.text: The debate has ended. The Knowledge Quarter will be officially launched on 11 December! @britishlibrary @KQ_London http://t.co/UwpQnB2S2c
